When any one bacteriochlorophyll absorbs a photon, the energy transfers among the photopigments until it reaches sufficient energy to donate the high-potential electron to a high-potential quinone: phylloquinone/phylloquinol an FeS protein.
Suppose you discover bacteria that require a high concentration of Fe2+ for photosynthesis.

The chlorosome is so sensitive that some chlorobia actually harvest thermal radiation from deep-sea thermal vents.
